document.docAuthor: Vivallo, Felipe, Vélez, Danny & Fernández, Fernando
document.masterDocTitle: Two new species of Centris (Aphemisia) Ayala, 2002 from Colombia with a synopsis of the subgenus for the country (Hymenoptera: Apidae: Centridini)

mods:titleInfo.mods:title: Two new species of Centris (Aphemisia) Ayala, 2002 from Colombia with a synopsis of the subgenus for the country (Hymenoptera: Apidae: Centridini)

subSubSection.paragraph:
Centris ( Aphemisia ) xanthosara Moure, 2002 : 258
(unnecessary nom . nov . for
Centris plumipes Smith, 1854
).

Type material.
Holotype female (British Museum of Natural History, BMNH, London, United Kingdom , examined).

caption.paragraph:
FIGURES 7−10.
Centris plumipes Smith, 1854
. Fig. 7. Female: Head, frontal view (scale bar 4.9 mm). Fig. 8. Habitus, lateral view (scale bar 5.4 mm). Fig. 9. Male: Head, frontal view (scale bar 7.6 mm). Fig. 10. Habitus, lateral view (scale bar 8.0 mm).

subSubSection.paragraph: Comment. Smith ( 1854 ) listed some morphological characters to identify the male of this species; however, it has never been formally described. The description presented here is based on two specimens from Araracuara, Department of Amazonas, Colombia .
